This wasn't just an April Fools joke. LTT actually bought a fire truck, and it turned into one of our most chaotic and fun projects. Linus and Luke break down how it all came together, from surprise electrical sparks to last-minute permits and some unexpected wildlife. They also talk about the merch, Floatplane exclusives, and how the whole thing somehow paid off.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4fVtzRYLYw

title: We bought a fire truck

A Chinese company called Betavolt has begun mass-producing coin-sized nuclear batteries that could power small devices for up to 50 years. Using nickel-63 and diamond semiconductors, these tiny power sources are being developed for use in medical, aerospace, and even consumer electronics like smartphones. Linus and Luke marvel at the tech’s potential and its surprisingly tiny size, literally smaller than a keycap.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4fVtzRYLYw

title: This Coin-Sized Chinese Nuclear Battery Lasts 50 Years

A Vizio TV user reports seeing a political ad looped in Scenic Mode. Yes, that Scenic Mode that’s supposed to play calming content while the TV is idle. The crew dives into how this happened, the ad-supported reality of modern smart TVs, and what you can do to avoid it (spoiler: it's not as simple as unplugging the Wi-Fi). Is it time we brought back truly dumb TVs?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4fVtzRYLYw

title: We need dumb TVs again

The U.S. government has introduced sweeping new tariffs under the “Liberation Day” initiative — and tech buyers could be hit hard. Linus and Luke break down the impact of tariffs reaching up to 46% on imports from key manufacturing hubs like China, Taiwan, Vietnam, and more. They also discuss what this means for GPU pricing, PC builders, and even LTT Store products. Buckle up — things are about to get expensive.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4fVtzRYLYw
